ground_truth: Ben watches it. Ben's face is shown as he watches. He continues watching, and the scene pulls back to reveal that they are in the Taft Hotel Room. Ben is sitting on the bed, leaning against the headboard, watching the television set on a stand facing the bed. The camera pulls back to a wide shot of the room, lit only by the light from the television set. Mrs. Robinson walks into the shot, half dressed, passing between Ben and the television set and then going out of frame. Ben continues to stare at the set as Mrs. Robinson appears again, passing the other way, and then passes back again. Now fully dressed and carrying her purse, Mrs. Robinson passes through once more and, without looking at Ben, goes to the hotel room door, opens it, and exits; the sound of the door closing is heard. Follow Ben as he gets up and moves to the windows of what is now his bedroom in the Braddock house. He opens the closed blinds over the window, revealing a bright sun outside. His bathing suit is on the window sill, and he takes it and puts it on. Ben moves to the bedroom door, opens it, and goes out. Mrs. Braddock is seen in the kitchen as Ben comes through the back door, moves to the pool, and dives in. The raft floats in the center of the pool as Ben swims toward us the length of the pool, then surfaces and, in one movement, pulls himself up on the raft, landing on top of Mrs. Robinson on the bed. He stays on top of her for a moment, then turns toward us and looks, where Mr. Braddock is standing by the side of the pool with the sun behind him. Mrs. Braddock steps in beside Mr. Braddock, followed by Mr. Robinson, and they blot out the sun as Mrs. Robinson steps in beside them. There is a long pause. The door opens and Mrs. Robinson enters, stopping to look at Ben, raising her eyebrows. Ben thinks for a moment and looks at her, as she pulls the covers down. He starts putting on his shirt while she sits on the edge of the bed, watching him and shaking her head. There is another long pause. Without looking at each other, they begin to take off their clothes at opposite sides of the room. Ben sits at the table, eating his breakfast and looking at the back of a cereal box, with Mr. and Mrs. Braddock also present. Benjamin looks at his father for a moment, then continues eating and reading. He slides off the raft and goes underwater, his hair streaming up and his eyes open. Mr. Robinson turns toward the sunroom.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Ben observes it. Ben's visage is displayed as he observes. He persists in observing, and the scene withdraws to reveal that they are in the Taft Hotel Room. Ben is seated on the bed, reclining against the headboard, observing the television set on a stand facing the bed. The camera withdraws to a wide view of the room, illuminated only by the glow from the television set. Mrs. Robinson strides into the view, partially dressed, passing between Ben and the television set and then proceeding out of frame. Ben persists in gazing at the set as Mrs. Robinson reappears, passing the opposite way, and then traverses back again. Now completely dressed and carrying her handbag, Mrs. Robinson traverses through once again and, without glancing at Ben, proceeds to the hotel room door, opens it, and departs; the noise of the door closing is heard. Follow Ben as he rises and proceeds to the windows of what is now his bedroom in the Braddock residence. He opens the shut blinds over the window, unveiling a bright sun outside. His swimwear is on the window ledge, and he seizes it and dons it. Ben proceeds to the bedroom door, opens it, and departs. Mrs. Braddock is observed in the kitchen as Ben comes through the back door, proceeds to the pool, and plunges in. The float drifts in the center of the pool as Ben swims toward us the length of the pool, then surfaces and, in one motion, hoists himself up on the float, landing atop Mrs. Robinson on the bed. He remains atop her for a moment, then pivots toward us and gazes, where Mr. Braddock is positioned by the side of the pool with the sun behind him. Mrs. Braddock steps in beside Mr. Braddock, accompanied by Mr. Robinson, and they obscure the sun as Mrs. Robinson steps in beside them. There is a lengthy pause. The door opens and Mrs. Robinson enters, pausing to gaze at Ben, raising her eyebrows. Ben reflects for a moment and gazes at her, as she pulls the covers down. He starts donning his shirt while she sits on the rim of the bed, observing him and shaking her head. There is another lengthy pause. Without glancing at each other, they begin to remove their attire at opposite sides of the room. Ben sits at the table, consuming his breakfast and gazing at the rear of a cereal box, with Mr. and Mrs. Braddock also present. Benjamin gazes at his father for a moment, then persists in consuming and reading. He slips off the float and goes underwater, his hair trailing up and his eyes open. Mr. Robinson turns toward the sunroom.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: It is watched by Ben. His face is shown as he watches. Watching is continued by him, and the scene reveals that they are in the Taft Hotel Room by pulling back. On the bed, leaning against the headboard, Ben is sitting, and the television set on a stand facing the bed is being watched by him. The room is shown by the camera pulling back to a wide shot, lit only by the light from the television set. Into the shot walks Mrs. Robinson, half dressed, passing between Ben and the television set and then going out of frame. The set continues to be stared at by Ben as Mrs. Robinson appears again, passing the other way, and then passes back again. Now fully dressed and carrying her purse, once more Mrs. Robinson passes through and, without looking at Ben, she goes to the hotel room door, opens it, and exits; the door is heard closing. Ben is followed as he gets up and moves to the windows of what is now his bedroom in the Braddock house. The closed blinds over the window are opened by him, revealing a bright sun outside. On the window sill is his bathing suit, and it is taken by him and put on. To the bedroom door, Ben moves, opens it, and goes out. In the kitchen, Mrs. Braddock is seen by him as he comes through the back door, moves to the pool, and dives in. In the center of the pool, the raft floats as Ben swims the length of the pool toward us, then surfaces and, in one movement, pulls himself up on the raft, landing on top of Mrs. Robinson on the bed. For a moment, he stays on top of her, then turns toward us and looks, where Mr. Braddock is standing by the side of the pool with the sun behind him. Beside Mr. Braddock steps Mrs. Braddock, followed by Mr. Robinson, and they blot out the sun when Mrs. Robinson steps in beside them. A long pause occurs. The door opens and Mrs. Robinson enters, stopping to look at Ben, raising her eyebrows. For a moment, Ben thinks and looks at her as she pulls the covers down. While she sits on the edge of the bed, watching him and shaking her head, he starts putting on his shirt. Another long pause occurs. Without looking at each other, they begin to take off their clothes at opposite sides of the room. At the table, Ben sits, eating his breakfast and looking at the back of a cereal box, with Mr. and Mrs. Braddock also present. For a moment, Benjamin looks at his father, then continues eating and reading. Off the raft, he slides and goes underwater, his hair streaming up and his eyes open. Toward the sunroom, Mr. Robinson turns.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Ben watches TV in the Taft Hotel Room. Sitting on the bed, he leans against the headboard, fixated on the television. The room is dimly lit by the TV. Mrs. Robinson enters, partially dressed, passing between Ben and the TV, and exits the frame. She reappears fully dressed, carrying her purse, and leaves without acknowledging Ben; the door closing is heard. Ben moves to his Braddock house bedroom, opens the blinds, and sees bright sunlight. He dons his swimsuit from the windowsill and exits. In the kitchen, Mrs. Braddock is visible as Ben heads to the pool and dives in. He swims to the pool's center, climbs onto a raft, ending up on top of Mrs. Robinson. He then looks at Mr. Braddock, standing poolside, with the sun behind him. Mrs. Braddock and Mr. Robinson join Mr. Braddock, blocking the sun as Mrs. Robinson joins them. After a pause, Mrs. Robinson enters, raises her eyebrows at Ben, who considers her before putting on his shirt. She sits on the bed, watching him, shaking her head. They undress on opposite sides of the room. Ben eats breakfast, reading a cereal box, with Mr. and Mrs. Braddock present. He glances at his father and continues eating. He slides off the raft, submerges, hair streaming, and eyes open. Mr. Robinson turns to the sunroom.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Ben watches TV in the Taft Hotel Room, sitting on the bed, leaning against the headboard. The room is lit by the TV as Mrs. Robinson, half-dressed, walks between Ben and the TV, exits, and reappears fully dressed. She leaves without looking at Ben. Ben moves to the windows of his Braddock house bedroom, opens the blinds to reveal sunlight, and puts on his bathing suit. He exits, enters the kitchen where Mrs. Braddock is, then goes to the pool and dives in. Ben swims, emerging on a raft next to Mrs. Robinson. They lie together as Mr. and Mrs. Braddock, joined by Mr. Robinson, stand by the pool, blocking the sun. Mrs. Robinson enters, looks at Ben, and raises her eyebrows. Ben dresses while she watches, eventually undressing without eye contact. Ben eats breakfast at the table with Mr. and Mrs. Braddock, glancing at his father before reading the cereal box and sliding off the raft underwater as Mr. Robinson turns to the sunroom.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Ben intently watches the television, lost in the screen. At the same time, we are shown Ben's face, portraying his concentration as he continues to watch. The camera gracefully pulls back, revealing the setting: they are in the Taft Hotel Room. Ben is comfortably seated on the bed, leaning back against the headboard, with his eyes fixed on the television set, which is strategically placed on a stand directly facing his resting place. As the camera further pulls back, a wide shot reveals the room, dimly lit solely by the flickering glow emanating from the television. At this moment, Mrs. Robinson calmly enters the frame, partially dressed, and walks right between Ben and the television, subsequently vanishing out of the scene. Unfazed, Ben maintains his gaze on the screen even as Mrs. Robinson reappears, crossing the frame in the opposite direction, and then once again retraces her steps. With each subsequent crossing, Mrs. Robinson becomes progressively more fully dressed, now carrying her purse with her. She finally passes one last time and, without acknowledging Ben, proceeds directly to the hotel room door, opens it, and exits, leaving behind the distinct sound of the door clicking shut.

Following this, Ben is seen getting up and moving toward the windows, now situated in his own bedroom within the Braddock house. He opens the blinds that had been closed over the window, allowing a bright and invigorating sun to flood the room. On the window sill rests his bathing suit, which he picks up and swiftly puts on. Ben moves to the bedroom door, opens it with purpose, and exits. Mrs. Braddock is busy in the kitchen as Ben coolly makes his way through the back door, heading confidently toward the pool, where he executes a smooth dive into the inviting water. The raft floats undisturbed at the center of the pool as Ben leisurely swims toward the camera, traveling the pool's entire length, before surfacing and, in a fluid motion, hauling himself up onto the raft. Once on the raft, he finds himself momentarily atop Mrs. Robinson, who is lying on the bed. After lingering for just a moment, he glances in our direction, where Mr. Braddock is stationed at the pool's edge, silhouetted against the sun. Mrs. Braddock joins him, quickly followed by Mr. Robinson as they collectively obscure the sun's rays, with Mrs. Robinson stepping in to stand beside them. An extended, contemplative pause ensues.

The door swings open once more, and Mrs. Robinson enters, pausing to gaze at Ben, a questioning expression evident in her raised eyebrows. Ben considers for a moment, locking eyes with her, as she pulls back the covers. He begins to put on his shirt while Mrs. Robinson perches on the edge of the bed, observing him and shaking her head slightly. Another extended pause fills the air. Without exchanging glances, they proceed to undress at opposite sides of the room, maintaining a mutual, silent understanding. Ben then sits at the table, savoring his breakfast while studying the back of a cereal box, with Mr. and Mrs. Braddock also present. Benjamin steals a glance at his father before returning to his meal and reading. With a fluid motion, he slips off the raft and submerges underwater, his hair flowing upward as his eyes remain wide open. Mr. Robinson, meanwhile, turns his attention toward the sunroom, bringing the scene to a thoughtful conclusion.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Ben is intensely focused as he watches the television, his entire attention captured by whatever is playing on the screen. Simultaneously, we are offered a close-up of Ben's face, revealing the depth of his concentration as he continues to be engrossed in the program. The camera gradually zooms out, gracefully expanding its view to unveil the setting: they are situated in the room of the Taft Hotel. Ben is comfortably reclined on the bed, with his back resting against the supportive headboard, and his eyes are unwaveringly locked on the television set, which is strategically positioned on a stand directly opposite where he sits, giving him a perfect view. As the camera further recedes, a wide-angle shot exposes the room, dimly illuminated solely by the flickering light coming from the television. At this point, Mrs. Robinson serenely enters into the scene, partially dressed, and walks directly between Ben and the television, subsequently disappearing out of the camera's view. Unperturbed by her presence, Ben retains his focus on the screen even as Mrs. Robinson reappears, crossing the frame from the opposite direction, and then once more retracing her steps. With each subsequent crossing, Mrs. Robinson is progressively more fully dressed, now holding her purse. She eventually passes by one last time and, without acknowledging Ben, heads straight for the hotel room door, opens it, and exits, leaving behind the unmistakable sound of the door clicking shut.

Following this sequence, Ben is observed rising and making his way toward the windows, having transitioned to his own bedroom located within the Braddock residence. He opens the blinds that had been drawn over the window, permitting a bright and invigorating sunlight to flood the room. On the window sill lies his bathing suit, which he promptly picks up and quickly puts on. With determination, Ben heads to the bedroom door, opens it with a clear sense of purpose, and exits. Mrs. Braddock is occupied in the kitchen as Ben casually makes his way through the back door, confidently moving toward the pool, where he performs a smooth, graceful dive into the inviting water. The raft drifts undisturbed at the center of the pool as Ben leisurely swims toward the camera, traversing the entire length of the pool, before emerging and, in one fluid motion, pulling himself up onto the raft. Once on the raft, he momentarily finds himself positioned atop Mrs. Robinson, who is lying comfortably on the bed. After pausing momentarily, he glances toward our direction, where Mr. Braddock stands at the pool's edge, silhouetted against the bright sun. Mrs. Braddock joins him, soon followed by Mr. Robinson as they collectively block the sun's rays, with Mrs. Robinson stepping in to stand alongside them. An extended, contemplative pause ensues.

The door swings open once more, and Mrs. Robinson enters, pausing to look at Ben, a questioning expression evident in her raised eyebrows. Ben takes a moment to consider, locking eyes with her, as she pulls back the covers. He begins to put on his shirt while Mrs. Robinson perches on the edge of the bed, watching him and shaking her head slightly. Another extended pause fills the room. Without exchanging any glances, they proceed to undress on opposite sides of the room, maintaining a silent yet mutual understanding. Ben then takes a seat at the table, savoring his breakfast while intently studying the back of a cereal box, with both Mr. and Mrs. Braddock also present. Benjamin sneaks a quick glance at his father before returning his attention to his meal and reading. With a smooth, fluid motion, he slips off the raft and submerges underwater, his hair flowing upward as his eyes remain wide open. Meanwhile, Mr. Robinson turns his focus toward the sunroom, bringing the scene to a thought-provoking conclusion.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Ben is intently watching the television, his eyes fixed steadily on the screen, and his facial expressions reflecting his engagement. As he continues to focus on the flickering images, the scene gradually zooms out, revealing the wider setting of the Taft Hotel Room. Ben is comfortably seated on the bed, his back resting against the headboard, while his eyes remain glued to the television set positioned on a stand facing him. The camera continues to withdraw, providing a full view of the room, which is dimly lit, with the only source of light emanating from the television. Mrs. Robinson enters the scene, partially dressed, moving casually between Ben and the television set in a manner that briefly interrupts his line of sight, before she disappears from the frame. Ben's gaze remains locked on the television as Mrs. Robinson reappears, crossing back in the opposite direction, only to pass by once more. Now fully clothed and with her purse in hand, Mrs. Robinson makes one final pass through the room, without acknowledging Ben, as she heads towards the hotel room door, opens it, and exits, allowing the sound of the door closing to resonate in the room. In the next moment, follow Ben as he rises from where he was sitting, transitioning with ease to the windows of what is now recognizable as his bedroom in the Braddock house. With a simple motion, he parts the closed blinds, unveiling the brilliant sunlight that floods into the room. Spotting his bathing suit sitting neatly on the window sill, he promptly grabs it and changes, preparing for the morning ahead. Ben then strides towards the bedroom door, opens it, and exits into the hall. As he moves through the house and enters the kitchen, Mrs. Braddock is already present, busy with her morning routine. Ben proceeds without pause to the backyard, makes his way to the pool, and, with a fluid motion, dives in. The raft bobs in the pool's center, providing a target for Ben as he swims the length of the pool, his strokes deliberate and strong. Upon reaching the raft, he smoothly hauls himself onto it, unexpectedly landing atop Mrs. Robinson, who is now on a bed-like surface. He lingers briefly atop her, before shifting his gaze to where Mr. Braddock is standing, his figure silhouetted by the sun behind him. Mrs. Braddock arrives to stand beside Mr. Braddock, soon joined by Mr. Robinson, who together obscure the sunlight as Mrs. Robinson completes the lineup. There is a lingering pause as they hold their positions. The door swings open, admitting Mrs. Robinson, who halts to observe Ben, her eyebrows arching in a silent query. Ben contemplates the situation and meets her gaze, as she begins to draw the covers down. He starts the process of putting on his shirt, while Mrs. Robinson perches herself at the edge of the bed, watching him steadily, a slight shake of her head signaling her thoughts. Another pause envelops the room as both of them, without meeting each other's eyes, commence undressing on opposite sides of the room. Later, Ben is comfortably seated at the table, engaged in eating his breakfast while his eyes peruse the back of a cereal box, sharing the space with Mr. and Mrs. Braddock. Briefly glancing at his father, Ben returns to the rhythm of eating and reading. He then slips off the raft into the water, submerging himself completely as his hair billows upwards and his eyes remain open, embracing the aquatic environment. Mr. Robinson shifts his attention towards the sunroom, maintaining his presence in the tranquil scene.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Ben watches the television with a focused expression, as the scene reveals he is in the Taft Hotel Room, sitting on the bed and leaning against the headboard. The room is dimly lit by the TV. Mrs. Robinson, half-dressed, enters the frame multiple times, moving between Ben and the TV, eventually leaving the room fully dressed with her purse, without acknowledging Ben. The door closes behind her, and Ben then transitions to his bedroom in the Braddock house, where he opens the blinds to reveal bright sunlight. He puts on his bathing suit from the windowsill, exits the bedroom, and heads to the pool. Diving in, he swims its length, then pulls himself onto a raft, visualized to be atop Mrs. Robinson on a bed. He briefly stays there before turning to see Mr. Braddock, Mrs. Braddock, and Mr. Robinson by the pool, with Mrs. Robinson joining them, casting shadows that blot out the sun. After a long pause, Mrs. Robinson enters again and silently communicates with Ben, who begins dressing while she watches. They undress separately, sharing a silent understanding. Ben later sits at a breakfast table with Mr. and Mrs. Braddock, examining a cereal box and exchanging a brief look with his father before continuing to eat. He slides off the raft in the pool, submerging himself, as Mr. Robinson turns toward the sunroom.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Ben watches it. Ben's face is shown as he watches. He continues watching, and the scene pulls back to reveal that they are in the Taft Hotel Room, a historic establishment in downtown New York known for its art deco architecture. Ben is sitting on the bed, leaning against the headboard, watching the television set on a stand facing the bed. The camera pulls back to a wide shot of the room, lit only by the light from the television set, creating an aura reminiscent of classic film noir. Mrs. Robinson, a character from a wealthy family who often frequents high-end hotels, walks into the shot, half dressed, passing between Ben and the television set and then going out of frame. Ben continues to stare at the set as Mrs. Robinson appears again, passing the other way, and then passes back again. Now fully dressed in a designer outfit and carrying her purse, Mrs. Robinson passes through once more and, without looking at Ben, goes to the hotel room door, opens it, and exits; the sound of the door closing is heard, echoing in the otherwise silent room. Follow Ben as he gets up and moves to the windows of what is now his bedroom in the Braddock house, a suburban home located in the affluent neighborhood of Pasadena, California. He opens the closed blinds over the window, revealing a bright sun outside, typical of the sunny southern Californian climate. His bathing suit is on the window sill, and he takes it and puts it on. Ben moves to the bedroom door, opens it, and goes out. Mrs. Braddock, always the early riser preparing the family breakfast, is seen in the kitchen as Ben comes through the back door, moves to the pool that was recently installed as part of a home renovation, and dives in. The raft floats in the center of the pool as Ben swims toward us the length of the pool, then surfaces and, in one movement, pulls himself up on the raft, landing on top of Mrs. Robinson, who is unexpectedly there on the bed. He stays on top of her for a moment, then turns toward us and looks, where Mr. Braddock is standing by the side of the pool with the sun behind him, casting a long shadow on the water. Mrs. Braddock, always supportive of family breakfasts, steps in beside Mr. Braddock, followed by Mr. Robinson, who is a successful businessman often preoccupied with work, and they blot out the sun as Mrs. Robinson steps in beside them. There is a long pause. The door opens and Mrs. Robinson enters, stopping to look at Ben, raising her eyebrows as if to signal a silent message. Ben thinks for a moment and looks at her, as she pulls the covers down. He starts putting on his shirt while she sits on the edge of the bed, watching him and shaking her head, perhaps in disapproval or disbelief. There is another long pause. Without looking at each other, they begin to take off their clothes at opposite sides of the room, indicating a silent agreement or routine. Ben sits at the table, eating his breakfast and looking at the back of a cereal box, with Mr. and Mrs. Braddock also present, the cereal touted as "The Breakfast of Champions." Benjamin looks at his father for a moment, then continues eating and reading, perhaps contemplating his next move. He slides off the raft and goes underwater, his hair streaming up and his eyes open, like a swimmer in a dream. Mr. Robinson, known for his stern demeanor, turns toward the sunroom, where he often spends his mornings reading the financial news.

In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. Mrs Braddock is seen in the kitchen as Ben comes through the back door moves to the pool and dives in. The raft floats in the center of the pool as Ben swims toward us. the length of the pool then surfaces and in one movement pulls himself up on the raft landing on top of Mrs Robinson on the bed. He stays on top of her for a moment then turns toward us and looks where Mr Braddock is standing by the side of the pool with the sun behind him. Mrs Braddock steps in beside Mr Braddock followed by Mr Robinson and they blot out the sun as Mrs Robinson steps in beside them. There is a long pause. The door opens and Mrs Robinson enters stopping to look at Ben raising her eyebrows. Ben thinks for a moment and looks at her as she pulls the covers down. He starts putting on his shirt while she sits on the edge of the bed watching him and shaking her head. There is another long pause. Without looking at each other they begin to take off their clothes at opposite sides of the room. Ben sits at the table eating his breakfast and looking at the back of a cereal box with Mr and Mrs Braddock also present. Benjamin looks at his father for a moment then continues eating and reading. He slides off the raft and goes underwater his hair streaming up and his eyes open. Mr Robinson turns toward the sunroom.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Ben watches it. Ben's face is shown as he watches. He continues watching and the scene pulls back to reveal that they are in the Taft Hotel Room. Ben is sitting on the bed leaning against the headboard watching the television set on a stand facing the bed. The camera pulls back to a wide shot of the room lit only by the light from the television set. Mrs Robinson walks into the shot half dressed passing between Ben and the television set and then going out of frame. Ben continues to stare at the set as Mrs Robinson appears again passing the other way and then passes back again. Ben thinks for a moment and looks at her as she pulls the covers down. He starts putting on his shirt while she sits on the edge of the bed watching him and shaking her head. There is another long pause. Without looking at each other they begin to take off their clothes at opposite sides of the room. Ben sits at the table eating his breakfast and looking at the back of a cereal box with Mr and Mrs Braddock also present. Benjamin looks at his father for a moment then continues eating and reading. He slides off the raft and goes underwater his hair streaming up and his eyes open. Mr Robinson turns toward the sunroom.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: Ben watches it. Ben's face is shown as he watches. He continues watching and the scene pulls back to reveal that they are in the Taft Hotel Room. Benjamin looks at his father for a moment then continues eating and reading. He slides off the raft and goes underwater his hair streaming up and his eyes open. Mr Robinson turns toward the sunroom.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Jake listens to it. Jake's expression is shown as he listens. He continues listening, and the scene pans back to reveal that they are in the Indigo Motel Suite. Jake is lounging on the couch, leaning against the cushions, listening to the radio perched on a table facing the couch. The camera pans back to a wide view of the suite, illuminated only by the glow from the radio. Ms. Peterson strides into the frame, partially dressed, weaving between Jake and the radio and then exits the shot. Jake continues to gaze at the radio as Ms. Peterson reappears, moving the other direction, before passing back once again. Now completely dressed and holding her handbag, Ms. Peterson steps through once more and, without glancing at Jake, heads to the motel suite door, opens it, and departs; the sound of the door closing echoes. Follow Jake as he rises and strolls to the curtains of what is now his studio in the Aldridge apartment. He opens the drawn shades over the glass pane, unveiling a brilliant sky outside. His beach towel is on the bookshelf, and he grabs it and wraps it around himself. Jake walks to the studio door, opens it, and heads out. Ms. Aldridge is visible in the living room as Jake enters through the patio, approaches the fountain, and plunges in. The lily pad drifts in the middle of the fountain as Jake paddles toward us the length of the fountain, then breaches and, in one fluid motion, hoists himself onto the lily pad, landing on top of Ms. Peterson on the couch. He remains atop her briefly, then turns toward us and sees, where Mr. Aldridge is standing by the edge of the fountain with the sky behind him. Ms. Aldridge steps in alongside Mr. Aldridge, followed by Mr. Peterson, and they block out the sky as Ms. Peterson steps in beside them. A lengthy silence ensues. The door opens and Ms. Peterson arrives, pausing to glance at Jake, raising her eyebrows. Jake ponders briefly and gazes at her, as she pulls the curtains down. He begins donning his jacket while she perches on the corner of the couch, observing him and shaking her head. Another lengthy silence follows. Without acknowledging each other, they commence removing their garments at opposite corners of the suite. Jake relaxes at the desk, munching his lunch and gazing at the back of a magazine, with Mr. and Mrs. Aldridge also in attendance. Jacob glances at his mother momentarily, then resumes munching and scanning. He slips off the lily pad and goes beneath the surface, his locks swirling upward and his vision clear. Mr. Peterson pivots toward the conservatory.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Ben watches television in a dimly lit Taft Hotel Room while Mrs. Robinson moves back and forth, getting dressed without acknowledging him. She eventually leaves, and Ben, now at home, opens the blinds to a sunny day. After putting on his bathing suit, he goes to the pool, dives in, and swims towards a raft. When he surfaces, he finds Mrs. Robinson with him on the raft. They share a moment before Ben notices Mr. Braddock, Mrs. Braddock, and Mr. Robinson standing by the pool, their presence casting a shadow. Later, Mrs. Robinson enters, raises her eyebrows at Ben, and they undress on opposite sides of the room without interaction. Ben eats breakfast with Mr. and Mrs. Braddock, briefly glancing at his father. He slides off the raft into the water as Mr. Robinson looks toward the sunroom.
